snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown is confronted by dire predictions about the future of California’s prison system, only six months after he declared the “crisis is over.”
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown is confronted by dire predictions about future of state’s overcrowded prison system, one of nation's largest, only six months after he declared 'crisis is over'; widespread inmate hunger strike in protest of state's policy of solitary confinement is in second week, and federal courts have demanded release of nearly 10,000 inmates and transfer of 2,600 others.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown is confronted by dire predictions about the future of California’s prison system, only six months after he declared the “crisis is over.”

headline.main: California Is Facing More Woes in Prisons
headline.print_headline: California Is Facing More Woes In Prisons
